intro: Orthodon japonicus var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf orthodon, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers appear in umbels, typical of the family. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
